intro: Nauclea aralioides, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Nauclea aralioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to high levels of sunlight.
